title: Questions, Likes, and Negatives
objectives: Say you don't do something using 안/못
context: Two small words open up conversation: 좋아하다 (to like) and -고 싶다 (to want).
안 and 못 sit before verbs to make simple negatives. 안 = don't, 못 = can't (unable).
Rising intonation turns statements into questions, or add -아요/어요? with a question mark.

vocabulary.english: Is it okay? / Are you okay?

sentences.english: I can't go today. Tomorrow works.
Do you need it? No, it's okay.

explanation: Add -아요/어요? with rising tone to ask yes/no questions. WH-words (뭐/언제/어디/누구/왜/어떻게) stay in place: 누구 좋아해요?
좋아하다 takes an object: 커피를 좋아해요. 'I like coffee.'
-고 싶어요 attaches to verb stems to express desire: 가고 싶어요 (I want to go), 배우고 싶어요 (I want to learn).
안 + verb = don't/won't (choice). 못 + verb = can't (ability/circumstance).
필요하다 means 'to need.' You can say 필요 없어요 = I don't need it.
